params.name: structType
params.description: CF2016+ Lucee4.5+ If set to `ordered` the order in which elements are added to the structure will be maintained. In Lucee `linked` can be used in place of `ordered`.

examples.title: New struct using literal notation
examples.code:
unordered = { a=1, c=3, b=2 };
writeDump( unordered );

examples.title: New struct using function
New ordered struct using literal notation
examples.description: CF2016+ Creates an ordered struct. Note the square brackets.
examples.code:
ordered = [ a=1, b=2, c=3 ];
writeDump( ordered );

examples.title: New ordered struct using function
examples.description: CF2016+ Lucee4.5+ Creates an ordered struct.
